attributes.action: abolish short selling on the London Stock Exchange
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
An article from next months Vanity Fair entitled 'Bringing Down Bear Stern'attributes this to a series of malicious rumours spread by international speculators who had shorted the stock. So far the Authorities have been unable to identify them and it is feared they may repeat their coup - possibly in the UK.
It is essential to take urgent action.
There are two possible cures, namely:
    1. Outlaw short selling and stock lending. (This would be unpopular with the market but in the National interest).
    2. Announce that the Government Broker has been authorised to buy shares in companies considered to be of National importance. The Hong Kong Authorities took similar action when Britain withdrew.
